page.title: 04LEISURE BROOMFIELD II
page.content: {Broomfield }has an active{footpath {society.}As well as exploring the local countryside they do a good job of keeping paths open. They "beat the bounds" annually, visiting boundary markers. Most walks end in a call at a local to refresh the walkers! The local{cubs, scouts and guides}use the "cub-scout" hut on most weekdays. The guides and brownies also use St. Mary's church hall. Their activities include games, badge work, outings and fund-raising activities. Broomfield also has an active {W.I. They also use the local church hall as a meeting place. Both villages have{bell-ringing teams and take part in competitions. The churches also have choirs.
